messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:46): https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=651888
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:47): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: maybe submit this idea to the devtools team
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:47): how do I do that?
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:48): well, I don't know the component :)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:48): Oh man, WebP finally has alpha, largely because Firefox complained that they wouldn't implement it without that.  ^_^
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:48): product: Firefox component: developer tools
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:49): 4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9: OK, I will also post it on #devtools
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:49): or Moz irc
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:51): 4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9: hmm, bugzilla UI does not seem to be offering me a "developer tools" component
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:51): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: Change product to Firefox and then submit the bug
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:51): you'll see the Firefox components later
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (19:51): (which is ugly)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:52): thanks
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:52): done
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (20:03): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: again, bz answers in less than 30 minutes :)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:07): I guess I knew about that shortcut
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:07): but I thought I'd found that it doesn't always seem to work as expected
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:07): but I  could be wrong
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:25): can somebody please tell me how do I submit a Chrome enhancement request?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:26): because I seem to not be able to figure it out on my own
8269fc4aca67c69ef320ddd69881d4cc (20:28): Isn't this the same way as creating a bug request?
8269fc4aca67c69ef320ddd69881d4cc (20:28): http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/list or something?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:28): the Template select control at http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/entry does not provide anything appropriate for enhancements
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:34): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, I'm pretty sure "Defect report from user" is correct for enhancement requests.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:43): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: You wanted assert_not_equals, right?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:46): (I meant to write that the first time rather than leave a dangling question)

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:00): This is so typical of IEBlog: IE9 is clearly better at resisting web page hangs than two of the three competing browsers, and they could have written a totally fair post that made IE look great, but they had to write one that was half FUD instead.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:00): (this is actually one of my major gripes with Firefox, although I'm kind of atypical in the number of sites I visit with long-running scripts . . .)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:01): (by which I mean that most of the time I use Firefox I'm visiting a page with long-running script)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:01): Hmm, what does IE do?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:01): IE is tab-per-process, so in IE9 it has no problem tolerating any kind of per-tab hang.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:02): Oh, you mean like that
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:02): So tabs can't hang the main UI, no matter what they do (in theory).
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:02): As opposed to Firefox, which completely freezes while script is running in any tab.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:02): Apparently Opera doesn't freeze on long-running script, but they say it can freeze on other types of tab hangs.  Not sure what that actually means.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:02): If anything.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:03): Well it means that we don't freeze on long running scripts
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:03): But if you manage to, say, hang the parser it can freeze
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:03): But that would only be due to a weird bug of some kind, right?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:03): Not something that's likely to be deliberately trigger-able.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:03): As opposed to while (true);.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:05): Well it is possible to make badness happen in the HTML5 algorithm I think
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:05): Even with the limits
8269fc4aca67c69ef320ddd69881d4cc (21:15): As a matter of fact, Opera does hang quite a lot with huge pages with lots of nodes...
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:23): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: ok (about enhancement filing)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:26): I'm guessing you can hang the engine in any browser if you force style resolution of many complex selectors in a giant document
